intro: Scabiosa leucocephala, commonly known as the whitehead scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, white, button-like flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
